Tensor Labbet presents a captivating blog with articles, reviews and unsolicited opinion pieces on the state of artificial intelligence research in academia and the industry

Tensor Labbet A blog of deep learnings

About

Taro Langner is a Machine Learning Scientist at Versiro, a Norwegian startup working on predictability for electricity markets in transition to green energy.

His PhD background and experience in the medical industry with clinical trials includes applied deep learning research for computer vision on radiology data. He published several deep learning papers as first author, co-authored a book on machine learning for MRI and contributed 40,000 deep-learning-based kidney measurements to the official UK Biobank data catalogue.

He founded this blog as a passion project in his spare time because he likes the way labbet (from Swedish tensorlabbet -> ‘The tensor lab’) rolls of his tongue and required an outlet for his free expressions of thoughts and opinions beyond anything peer review, quality control or good taste would normally allow.
